sen.j: また木戸の反対を押し切る形で1876年8月5日の太政官布告108号において、禄制の全面的廃止と金禄公債切り替えのための金禄公債証書発行条例を公布した。
sen.e: Despite KIDO's opposition, OKUMA issued an edict of Daijokan No.108 on August 5, 1876 which enforced complete abolition of the stipend and an issuance of public bond certificates.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: これに基づいて秩禄を受けていた者の禄高は1875年の府県ごとの貢納石代相場に応じて換算金額（金禄元高）が定められた。

tit.e: Shizoku no hanran (revolts by former samurai warriors) and Shizoku jusan (a policy which helped former warriors get a job)

sen.j: 地租改正による農民一揆と並び、神風連の乱や西南戦争（1877年）など明治初期の士族反乱は、秩禄処分により収入が激減した士族階級の不平が原因であった考えられている。
sen.e: Like peasant uprising caused by the land-tax reform, revolts by former samurai warriors, such as Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, a dissatisfied warrior group) and the Seinan War (1877), were led by former warriors who suffered from less income caused by Chitsuroku-shobun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Like peasant uprising caused by the land-tax reform, revolts by former samurai warriors, such as Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, a dissatisfied warrior group) and the Seinan War (1877), were led by former warriors who suffered from drastic reduction of their income caused by Chitsuroku-shobun.
sen.cmt: 「収入の激減」を明確に表現します。
sen.e: Like peasant uprising caused by the land-tax reform, revolts by former samurai warriors, such as Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, a dissatisfied warrior group) and the Seinan War (1877), were led by former warriors who suffered from drastic reduction of their income caused by Chitsuroku-shobun.

sen.j: 一方で士族反乱に参加した士族の大半は金禄公債証書発行以前から政府を批判しており、また決起の趣旨に秩禄処分が挙げられているケースが少ない事も指摘されている。
sen.e: On the other hand there is another theory that most of former warriors who joined the revolts had criticized the government since before the issuance of the public bond, and their reason for joining the revolts was not Chitsuroku-shobun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, some people insists that most of the former warriors who joined the revolts had criticized the government since before the issuance of the public bond, and their reason for joining the revolts was not Chitsuroku-shobun.
sen.cmt: 「一方で…と指摘されている」を分かりやすい形に言い換えます。

sen.j: 士族の救済政策として士族授産が行われ、屯田兵制度による北海道開発も実施された。
sen.e: As a remedy for former warriors, the government implemented a policy of Shizoku jusan, and launched development of Hokkaido by ex-legionary.

sen.e: An report issued by Tottori Prefecture in 1882, which said that 90% of all former warriors had already bought their public bonds, verified this fact.
